HEAD.title: Pennsylvania Spatial Data Access | Full Metadata

BODY.H2: Biofuel Feedstock Potential in the Chesapeake Bay - Switchgrass on Abandoned Cropland

DL.DD: Biofuel Feedstock Potential in the Chesapeake Bay - Switchgrass on Abandoned Cropland

DIV.PRE: This layer shows potential land area for the production of biofuel feedstocks, specifically switchgrass, on cropland that has been abandoned since 1969. This time frame was chosen to exclude abandoned land that has developed a mature forest cover, and consequently an inapropriate location for growing switchgrass. Areas and corresponding crop production totals are aggregated by counties in the Chesapeake Bay.

This dataset is intended to illustrate the potential for biofuel production in the Chesapeake Bay, in a manner that does not compete with current food or fiber production. This data was used in support of a Chesapeake Bay Commission report titled: "Chesapeake Biofuel Policies: Balancing Energy, Economy and Environment" published in 2010.

DL.DD: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.2 (Build 3790) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

DD.DL:
Map_Projection_Name:Albers Conical Equal Area
Albers_Conical_Equal_Area: Albers Conical Equal AreaStandard_Parallel:29.500000Standard_Parallel:45.500000Longitude_of_Central_Meridian:-96.000000Latitude_of_Projection_Origin:23.000000False_Easting:0.000000False_Northing:0.000000

DL.DD: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

DIV.PRE: Maximum cropland area of any year since 1969
Maximum cropland area of any year since 1969 (ha)
Number of NLCD pixels that transitioned from Ag to Urban classes between 1992 and 2001
Number of NLCD pixels that transitioned from Ag to non-urban classes between 1992 and 2001
% of ag land that transitioned to urban from 1992 to 2001
% of abandoned cropland that is estimated to have transitioned to urban (Aban1969 * PctUrbCh)
Cropland abandoned since 1969 that has not transitioned to urban and is therefore a potential resource for switchgrass production (Aban1969 - 69ToUrbn)
Switchgrass production multiplied by .4 to derive a low estimate (Mg)
Switchgrass production multiplied by .75 to derive a high estimate (Mg)
Adjusted switchgrass production total multiplied by .1 to adjust for land owner willingness-to-manage
Adjusted switchgrass production total multiplied by .25 to adjust for land owner willingness-to-manage
